intro: It seems in short supply in today's world, but the Bible is packed with words of wisdom. How wise will you be when it comes to these questions?

questions.ask: What precious metal, according to Proverbs, cannot compare to the value of wisdom?
What does Proverbs say is the "beginning of wisdom"?
To whom, according to Proverbs, does a man who loves wisdom bring joy?
What relative do the Proverbs say a young man should call wisdom?
According to Proverbs, what does the person who gets wisdom love?

intro: Wives in the Bible come in all varieties - good, bad, and indifferent. What can you recall about these?

questions.ask: What great patriarch took a wife named Keturah after his first wife died?
How many wives did Solomon have - in addition to his three hundred concubines
What daughter of King Saul became the wife of David - for the price of two hundred dead Philistines?
Which apostle's wife accompanied him on ministry trips, according to Paul?
What second wife of Elkanah provoked his other wife, Hannah, over her barrenness?

intro: Here's your big hint - because you see quotation marks in the quiz title, all of the answers will begin with the letter W/

questions.ask: What did God use to take the prophet Elijah into heaven?
What word is paired with "signs" to describe the miraculous doings of the apostles after Pentecost?
What ravenous animal would feed peacefully with the lamb in the new earth prophesied by Isaiah?
What did the patriarch Jacob do all night with God at a place called Peniel?
What is the name of the star that falls to earth and poisons a third of the water, as described in Revelation?

intro: You've worked your way through most of the alphabet, to a quiz about "workers". Give your memory a good workout, and try to answer these questions.

questions.ask: What word did Jesus use to describe the workers compared to the "plentiful" harvest of souls?
What did the apostle Paul, writing to the Thessalonians, say that those who refused to work should be kept from doing?
What man, who once deserted Paul's mission work in Pamphylia, did the apostle later call "helpful" and ask Timothy to bring to him?
What did Jesus once say a worker was worthy of?
What word did the writer of Ecclesiastes use to describe the sleep of a laborer?
